intro: Eysenhardtia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf yucca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family, which includes many succulent and ornamental plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and minimal water requirements. Its botanical characteristics make it a hardy and low-maintenance plant suitable for xeriscaping and desert gardens.
